title: Conflicting impls where one type is an associated type should provide a note that another crate could define the associated type to make the impls overlap

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: [[playground]](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=ac0ec13c782fd22f9efa6a20aef81f5a)

```rust
pub trait Trait<X> {}

impl<X> Trait<X> for X::Owned
where
    X: ToOwned,
{}

impl<X> Trait<X> for &X
{}

```

The current nightly (2022-07-01) output is:

```
error[[E0119]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0119): conflicting implementations of trait `Trait<_>` for type `&_`
 --> src/lib.rs:8:1
  |
3 | impl<X> Trait<X> for X::Owned
  | ----------------------------- first implementation here
...
8 | impl<X> Trait<X> for &X
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ conflicting implementation for `&_`
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[[E0119]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0119): conflicting implementations of trait `Trait<_>` for type `&_`
 --> src/lib.rs:8:1
  |
3 | impl<X> Trait<X> for X::Owned
  | ----------------------------- first implementation here
...
8 | impl<X> Trait<X> for &X
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ conflicting implementation for `&_`
  | 
  = note: another crate could provide some `X: ToOwned<Owned=X>`
```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->

I've spent multiple hours trying to figure out how this impl could be overlapping on at least two separate occasions. I'd like to prevent that from happening again 🙂

(An *even more fun* case is `impl<X> Trait<&X> for &&X`, as the conflicting `&X: ToOwned<Owned=&&X>` can only exist with a coherence-impacting proof that `X: !Clone`.)

<!--
If dramatically different output is caused by small changes, consider also
adding them here.

If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions. The output might also be
different depending on the Edition.
-->
